description: My very first web project, which I crafted during an exciting bootcamp journey. This site was brought to life using a combination of HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript, showcasing my early coding endeavors.

Driven by my love for live music experiences, I designed this website to capture memories of the concerts I've attended. Crafted with a blend of React, HTML, CSS, Material UI, MongoDG and Express.js, it's a digital diary of my musical journey.
For our bootcamp final project, two classmates and I created a full-stack e-commerce website using React, CSS, HTML,  Ant Design, Express.js, MongoDB, and Node.js.
My very first website/portfolio featuring a mix of React, CSS, HTML, Bootstrap and some cool animations created with vanilla JavaScript and React.js.

Frontend Mentor Challenge: I built this landing page using CSS, HTML, Flexbox, CSS Grid, CSS Variables, and a mobile-first workflow. The goal was to develop the website as closely as possible to the Figma design.

Frontend Mentor Challenge: I built this landing page using React, CSS, HTML,  Flexbox, CSS Grid, CSS Variables, and a mobile-first workflow. The goal was to develop the website as closely as possible to the Figma design.
The second version of my website/portfolio was created with React, CSS and HTML. It was also the project where I had my first experience using Figma for design practice.

Frontend Mentor Challenge: I built this calculator app using React, HTML, CSS, Flexbox and Grid, CSS Variables and Transitions. The goal was to develop the website as closely as possible to the Figma design.

My website new design for 2024. Designed and built by me, using React, CSS, HTML, Flexbox, CSS Variables, JSON and Figma. This represents a fusion of the skills I acquired in 2023, including some cool animations using Framer Motion.

The goal of this project is to enhance user experience, improve functionality, modernize the visual aesthetics of the existing website, implement the new company logo and keep the current colour pallet.

Introducing the enhanced iteration of my prior web project, 'Concerts Database,' built on the robust MERN Stack framework. Originally crafted in 2022, this updated version is on its way! Stay tuned for the unveiling. (COMING SOON)

Test your knowledge of the classic Star Wars movies with this quiz! This interactive game challenges you to answer questions about the original Star Wars trilogy. Choose a movie, answer questions, and see your score. This project won first place at the Code Institute May 2024 Hackathon.

First project for the Code Institute Diploma in Full Stack Software Development. The goal was to use the knowledge acquired in the course and establish a website dedicated to Devon Rex. Using HTML, CSS, and Figma, I turned this vision into reality. Head over to the GitHub README section for all the project insights!

Second project for the Code Institute Diploma in Full Stack Software Development. The goal is to create a Simon game using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Sass, demonstrating the skills and concepts learned throughout the course. The project emphasizes user interaction, game logic, and efficient styling. For a detailed breakdown, check out the GitHub README.
